block.p: The German Parliament approved a bill, on a vote of 556 to 42, that set the stage for compensation to Nazi slave laborers and other Holocaust victims. German industry and the government will each pay $2.5 billion to the fund.
The vote ends a half-century of denial of responsibility by German manufacturers, including the German subsidiaries of Ford and General Motors.

The vote ends a half-century of denial of responsibility by German manufacturers, including the German subsidiaries of Ford and General Motors.
Previously, German manufacturers argued that the Nazis had simply required them to use the forced workers.
